alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:57PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Weber...northwestern Wasatch...Salt Lake...eastern Davis... southwestern Morgan...southwestern Summit...north central Utah and northeastern Tooele Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 656 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Magna to Little Cottonwood Canyon. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Sandy, Layton, Murray, Bountiful, Farmington, Park City, Morgan, Coalville, West Jordan, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Draper, Riverton, Cottonwood Heights, Midvale, Kaysville, Holladay and South Salt Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 291 and 332. Interstate 84 between mile markers 88 and 108, and between mile markers 118 and 119. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 102 and 167. US Route 40 between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
